title: Ode to the Bridge Builder
statementHtml:
You are given a 2D plane. Initially, two points P1P1 and P2P2 are located at (0,0)(0,0) and (1,0)(1,0), respectively, with a line segment connecting them. You can draw triangles using the following operation:

Note that each operation draws one new point and two new line segments.

Your task is to draw a point at coordinates (p,q) using at most m=⌈2√p2+q2⌉ operations, where ⌈x⌉ is the smallest integer greater than or equal to x. It is guaranteed that p and q are positive integers.

Due to potential rounding errors:

Note that the target point may be created before the last operation (see the second test case).
inputSpecHtml:
Each test contains multiple test cases. The first line contains the number of test cases t (1≤t≤1000). The description of the test cases follows.

The first line of each test case contains three integers p, q, and m (1≤p,q≤104, m=⌈2√p2+q2⌉) — the x and y coordinates of the target, and the maximum number of operations you are allowed to perform, respectively.

It is guaranteed that the sum of m over all test cases does not exceed 105.
outputSpecHtml:
For each test case, output a single integer n (0≤n≤m) representing the number of operations used.

Then, output n lines describing the operations. The i-th of the next n lines should contain four values: two integers u and v (1≤u,v≤i+1,u≠v), the identifiers of the two chosen points, followed by two real numbers x and y (−2⋅104≤x,y≤2⋅104), the coordinates of the new point.

The identifiers are assigned as follows:

  • The identifiers of point P1(0,0) and P2(1,0) are 1 and 2, respectively.
  • The identifier of the point drawn during the j-th operation is j+2.

If there are multiple valid solutions that use at most m operations, you may output any of them.
noteHtml:
In the first case, you can perform at most ⌈2√2⌉=3 operations. The following solution uses only two operations:

  1. Choose points A=P1 and B=P2. Draw a new point P3 at coordinates (12,√32). The lengths of all sides of triangle △P1P2P3 are all 1.
  2. Choose points A=P2 and B=P3. Draw a new point P4 at coordinates (1,1). The lengths of the sides of triangle △P2P3P4 are |P2P3|=|P2P4|=1, |P3P4|=2sin(15∘)≈0.5176≥0.5.

In the second case, you can perform at most ⌈2√10⌉=7 operations.

In the solution shown below, the points P4 and P5 are at coordinates (2−√32,12) and (1+√32,12) respectively, and |P4P6|=|P2P5|=1. It can be verified that the length of every line segment lies within [0.5,1].

Note that the last operation is unnecessary, and the solution is still correct without the last operation.
